summary: Regenerative practices focus on restoring and enhancing natural systems, aiming to create positive environmental impacts beyond sustainability. This approach encompasses various fields, including agriculture, economics, and design, emphasizing holistic solutions that regenerate ecosystems, communities, and resources. By mimicking natural processes and fostering biodiversity, regenerative methods seek to reverse environmental degradation, improve soil health, increase carbon sequestration, and promote resilient ecosystems. This innovative concept extends beyond mere conservation, actively working to heal and revitalize our planet while supporting human needs in harmony with nature.
